snippet: In a court filing in Philadelphia, two doctors from the Brain Injury Association of America said the N.F.L.’s proposed settlement would exclude many players and limit their access to benefits.
abstract: NFL Roundup; Brain Injury Assn of America says proposed settlement between NFL and current and former players for hiding the dangers of concussions is flawed because the definitions of eligibility are too narrow; other football news noted.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and BEN SHPIGEL

lead_paragraph: In a court filing in Philadelphia, two doctors from the Brain Injury Association of America said the N.F.L.’s proposed settlement would exclude many players and limit their access to benefits.

headline.main: Doctors Fault Assumptions of Settlement With Retirees
headline.print_headline: Doctors Fault Assumptions of Settlement With Retirees
